intro: Verbascum nikolovii, commonly known as the Balkan mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in dense, soft hairs, which help reduce water loss. Verbascum nikolovii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
